paper_abstract: Quantum memory channels are attracting growing interest, motivated by both realistic possibilities of transferring information by means of quantum hardware and inadequacies of the memoryless approximation. In fact, subsequent uses of the same quantum transmission resource can be significantly correlated. In this paper we review two Hamiltonian models describing memory effects in a purely dephasing spin-boson channel and in a channel with damping visualized by a micromaser system, respectively. In both cases, we show that the quantum information transmission rates are higher than in the memoryless limit.
paper_title: HAMILTONIAN MODELS FOR QUANTUM MEMORY CHANNELS
